There are $n$ trees ($1 \le n \le 10^5$) lined up in a row. Each tree has a nut on top, and the height of each tree is given as $h_i$ ($1 \le h_i \le 10^4$). You start at the base of the first tree.

You can perform the following actions:

* Walk up or down one unit on a tree.
* Eat the nut on the top of the current tree.
* Jump to the next tree if you are at a height less than or equal to the height of the next tree.

Find the minimum time (in seconds) it takes to eat all the nuts.

You have a row of trees, each with a different height. You start at the first tree and need to eat a nut from the top of each tree. You can move up or down one tree at a time, or jump to the next tree if it's lower than your current height. What is the fastest way to eat all the nuts?
